decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, utilizing spells like Goryo's Vengeance, Reanimate, and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Unmask, and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal are used to accelerate mana generation, allowing for explosive plays. The inclusion of Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Dauthi Voidwalker provides additional flexibility and protection, making this deck a formidable combo-reanimator archetype in the Legacy format.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and counter magic like Force of Will. It also includes versatile removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command to deal with threats. The deck utilizes card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find answers and card advantage engines like Baleful Strix to outvalue opponents. The deck also includes powerful threats like Snapcaster Mage and Barrowgoyf to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win with efficient threats.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish control over the board by using small aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to keep up pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland and Lightning Bolt. The overall strategy is to maintain card advantage and tempo to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The key idea of this Doomsday combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary components to cast Doomsday, set up a winning pile with Thassa's Oracle, and win the game on the spot. Utilizing cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal for fast mana acceleration, along with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig through the deck efficiently, the deck aims to overpower opponents with its powerful win condition. By carefully planning out its strategy and protecting its combo with counterspells like Force of Will, the deck can swiftly secure victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The core strategy of this Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck is to control the early game with counterspells and removal while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler. By utilizing powerful cards like Wasteland and Daze to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck aims to maintain tempo advantage and overwhelm the opponent with threats. The versatility of cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm allows for consistent card selection and ensures a smooth curve of threats throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using cards like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong combo finish. Control elements like Force of Will and Brainstorm help protect the combo pieces, while disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has some creature removal in the form of Fatal Push and Brazen Borrower to deal with threats. Overall, the key strategy is to reanimate powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a quick combo.

This Aggro - Dragon Stompy deck focuses on quickly dropping powerful creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void, Magus of the Moon, and Blood Moon. The deck utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to cast big threats like Fury, The One Ring, and Pyrogoyf. By locking down opponents' lands and spells while constantly applying pressure, this deck aims to overwhelm and control the game before the opponent can stabilize.
